title: Correlative Imaging as a Prospecting Tool for Biophysics and Bioinspiration
content: Microscopy and microanalysis allow us to see the seemingly invisible. Through history, microscopes have revealed unseen microstructures and morphologies, giving the power of discovery to people with advanced microscopes or even simple hand lenses. Rapid developments in microscopy and microanalysis have increased the potential for discovery across length scales and modalities, including chemical, crystallographic, and mechanical characterisation among others.
